intro: Senecio larahuinensis, commonly known as the Chilean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system. It produces small yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio larahuinensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
